ja2:1.2: Resolve udaṅgaṇa as uda (“water”) and aṅgaṇa, from a root sense of “going”, from where we find the Sanskrit sense of “passage” (against the commentary, which says uda is a mere particle). In the prose story, the Bodhisatta, lost with his caravan in the desert, hears water rushing underground and urges a young man to dig.
